title: why am i lagging so hard
body: took multiple ping tests that dont show a high ms yet i get 500 on the riot server when i usually get 60.  reinstalled league, restarted laptop twice.  is this a sign that i should quit?  If not, what the fuck do i do?

replies.body:
Each server you connect to resides in a different geolocation, therefore your connection will take different network routing to each one. This means you can have a problem connecting to one server while having no issues connecting to another. We can certainly take a look at your network routing to the League servers, but I'd first like you to ensure your local network settings are configured per our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if you still see high latency (ms) after working through that guide.

my results for ping were:
"Ping statistics for 216.58.192.68:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 15ms, Maximum = 27ms, Average = 19ms"
but im still getting 140ms in game and having trouble logging in

Our test IP for the NA server is actually 104.160.131.1, so I recommend testing to that. 

Did you complete all the steps in that connection guide?
i can watch netflix and youtube in hd with no buffering simultaneously, but i CANT LOGIN TO THIS JAMOKE ASS GAME

update:  i may have gotten it down to 150ms but i still usually play on 60.  also it takes 10 billion years to log on.  this started happening when my game froze in the middle of a ranked a match i tried to relogin.  all the problems started there.  As i was typing this i recieved a message whilst trying to login about an unknown error.  i really love this ever=rio[tenjio[tjoh4tq]koh4rjioy45njpo4htqnjpoht4htw4hhrh4wht4wh4qhqheq;lkn
